Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Zzz...
Aurora?
Zzz...
Zz...
Zzzzzz...
Well, that's disturbing.
Command to Aurora, do you copy?
Zzz...
Kapitan. A small fleet of Morganas is approaching from starboard.
You just woke up and you're already on top of things?
I am a light sleeper. To arms?
... To arms.
@BATTLE
You're dozing off again.
Am I? I hadn't noticed.
You squint when you're trying to stay awake.
Perhaps I'm trying to get a better view of our surroundings.
And you *sound* sleepy. Do you want something to keep you awake?
... I *do* enjoy a game of chess.
Then let's play.
Not now, Kapitan. We have more important things to attend to.
Such as?
*ALARM*
As I said.
Of course Morgana attacks take priority.
Of course.
@BATTLE
Is this a ploy to get me into your bed, Kapitan? Because if so, I think I'll have to decline.
No matter how we feel about each other, I don't sleep with my subordinates.
I was thinking something like a game. Something to keep your mind busy.
My mind is always busy, Kapitan.
You could not keep up with me, Kapitan.  I would crush you like an insect.
Maybe that's what I like.
You protest too much.
Perhaps war *has* hardened you.
Are we still on for that game of chess?
I suppose I can set aside my other duties for a moment.
What's that smell?
I made coffee. Don't suppose you'd want some.
More subterfuge, comrade?

Fields.MenuText: I know you don't want me looking after you, but...
Would you rather I told you you look tired?

Fields.DialogueText: Lie to me all you like, Kapitan, but I'll remember.
I am not a child who needs to be put to sleep.
Of course not. That's why I offered you coffee.
I wouldn't take it personally, if that's what you're asking.
If I can take charge of our future, I can take care of myself.
I never said you couldn't. But even you have to let down your guard sometime.
I have. But as much as I don't share your vision for the world... I still want you in it.
You understand so little, Kapitan. And your coffee's gone cold.
If you don't drink it, I will.
*sips*
*ALARM*
Damn, I spilled my coffee.
A tragic loss.
@BATTLE
To a known enemy? I think not.
To a friend who wants to help.
You've stated your intentions.
It's past midnight and you're still at work?
It is eleven AM Universal Time, Kapitan.
We may need to sleep, but diplomacy does not.
So instead of sleeping, you're up writing more letters to His Majesty?
Very pointed letters, yes.
Oh, really? I've been thinking about writing a few of my own.
To the King of England?
To Command. About what happened aboard this ship.
Ah. The situation with Kanzaki and Zamora?
Precisely.
You know that the penalty for mutiny is death.
Yes. And I also know that there was no trial before that penalty.
Kanzaki made his choices. Just as you will make yours.
But I am curious, Kapitan. Why tell me?
Hm?
If you want to set an investigation in motion, so be it. But why tell your enemy how you plan to attack?

Fields.MenuText: Healthy distrust makes a good base for cooperation.
I'm just trying to make sure justice is done.

Fields.DialogueText: If that is how you choose to see it.
Very droll. But you didn't answer my question.
Da. But if you don't see the world as it is, can justice be done?
You're part of the crew. You have as much right to know what's going on aboard as anyone else.
You underestimate my knowledge of my own affairs, Kapitan. For example...
... We're about to be interrupted.
*ALARM*
I should be used to you doing that by now.
Da. Battle stations, Kapitan?
... Affirmative.
@BATTLE
Huh? Where am I?
This isn't Aurora's deck... or is it?
Captain! We've sighted an armada off the starboard bow. They look like wrecked ships, but--
That's more shipwrecks than I've ever seen in one place. And somehow they're still moving!

Fields.MenuText: Get this man off the deck, NOW.

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain, can't you see them?
I'm sober, Captain, I swear--
What's a Morgana? Oh, you mean fata morgana?
That's not--
Are you serious?
Kapitan, follow me!
That girl's on the deck of the shipwreck! What's she doing?
What *are* you doing?! I thought you couldn't leave-- shouldn't leave--
I am advancing. If you are wise, you'll do the same.
She's moving between the decks. Leaving carnage in her wake. I've never seen anything like it...
Captain, what should we do?
Get to your stations. We're going to provide support.
@BATTLE
This must be Morgana mist. I'd better be careful.
It's... beautiful.
There's too many of them, Captain! What do we do?
We can't fight our way out of this. Aurora's tough, but no one is *that* tough.
... Why are all the ship's alarms...? Is there another saboteur aboard?
*ALARM*
Captain?
*ALARM*
Daaaah!
... Oh. Was it all just a dream...?
We're going to advance, extract her if we can, and then--
Whatever it was... that was the real alarm. I'd better get to the bridge.
Did you sleep well, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: How can you ask that at a time like this?
Like the dead. Now let's move.

Fields.DialogueText: Curiosity gets one's nose torn off at the market.
Of course, Kapitan.
Because I am disappointed, Kapitan.
Now. As I said before: *follow me.*
*WHAM*
No time, Kapitan. We advance or we die.
@BATTLE
... (I don't know what's going on, but no matter what's happening, I don't want to sacrifice my crew.)
... Then why do I feel so tired? And why do I smell Morgana mist?
... You saw what happened back there, didn't you?
Yes.
Was I hallucinating, or were they real?
That's privileged information, Kapitan.
If something's making me unfit to command, I damn well need to know about it!
Give me the radio. ... Sailors!
Once again, we fight against our hated enemy. They come to us with mortars and torpedoes, with rams and gunfire. But their greatest weapons are fear and despair.
You have torn Despair to pieces with your own hands. Remember your triumph, and remember the comrades who stood beside you in that hour.
Stand by their side, and do not falter!
The dawn will come. And if we stand together, you will live to see it.
Another fine speech.
We're entering a hot zone. If you want to do your thing, now's your chance.
It was necessary. We are still hardening these men.
You don't do anything that wastes energy, do you?
Of course not.
Then why do you keep harping on that... hallucination? Dream? Whatever-it-was?
I'd think they'd be pretty hardened by now.
You would think that.
I would not have if it was not important.

Fields.MenuText: Quit being cagey. What do you really want?

Fields.DialogueText: This is not reluctance.
I am talking. It is you who are not listening.
No, Kapitan.
I just want to know what's going on.
*BOOM*
All in good time, comrade.
@BATTLE
You've brought a chessboard, Kapitan?
We're both off duty. I thought it'd be fun.
"Fun" doesn't do much in these waters.
No, but everyone deserves a break. You can't fight if you're exhausted.
If it will make you stop fussing, I'll play.
Great, I'll set up the board.
So, tell me...
How did you know what I saw, back there?
I don't think that was a dream. Not in the conventional sense.

Fields.MenuText: How much do you know about this?

Fields.DialogueText: Little more than you.
Don't interrupt me.
Let me finish.
These are not your common Morgana mist hallucinations. Nor are they dreams.
They are things that will happen in the future, or have happened in the past. Distorted, misshapen, but visions nonetheless.
Is that why you keep falling asleep?
*Vot imenno.* Precisely it.
I have seen things in these visions that came to pass. If I were to ignore them, I'd be ignoring valuable intelligence.
So that's why you've been trusting them.
Is that such a shock?
You're a materialist, aren't you?
*ALARM*
Okay, people, battle stations!
By the way, Kapitan--
Check.
@BATTLE
They are laid over the waking world like colored glass. And if something happens in one of these visions, it happens in reality.
Writing another letter, Comrade Kapitan?
Aurora! I didn't realize you were in here.
I was not.
... I'm reading a letter from Command. It's not orders or anything like that.
Well, you startled me. Was there something you wanted to talk about?
I wanted to continue our game. But this is a more pressing matter, nyet?
Nyet. Uh, I mean. Yes.
So it's related to your investigation.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, so I'd prefer not to share it.

Fields.DialogueText: You left your soul wide open. Even so...
Hm. I won't pry, but...
Do not worry.  I shan't intrude. But...
I'm certain I can guess the contents of that letter.
I haven't finished reading it. So your guess is as good as mine.
The Neutrality Fleet will not oppose an investigation into the death of a sailor, no matter how innocuous. We must preserve our integrity. *However...*
You have to understand that as the flagship of the Red Fleet, I have some measure of... diplomatic immunity.
So what you're saying is, if there was an investigation, and they *did* decide your actions were unwarranted...
You'd get a slap on the wrist.
If that.
Well? Was my assessment correct?
You were right on the money.
I have my sources.
*ALARM*
Well. Politics don't matter if we don't win the war.
Politics *is* war by other means. By the way, Kapitan...
Your king is still in check.
@BATTLE
... Where am I? Is this another vision?
*BOOM*
This looks like the deck of the Aurora, but... she's so new.
Kapitan! We're under attack by Rusalki again!

Fields.MenuText: Those Morganas look so old. Are they from the Great War?

Fields.DialogueText: Right away.
Huh? Those are top-of-the-line ships, they've just been wrecked...
So what do we do?
It doesn't matter.
We stand and fight. Don't let them gain ground.
@BATTLE
Where's Aurora?
Did you hit your head? You're aboard her.
Kapitan, this way!
I can't move!
It's like I'm paralyzed--
Gather your strength. I know you have the will to fight.
*BOOM*
Kapitan, the deck's collapsing!
Advance or die!
*BOOM*
*GASP!*
... Damn. These visions are getting out of control.
@BATTLE
I... I *felt* that explosion.
... Aurora knows more about this than she's letting on. Before this happens again...
... We need to talk.
Forward, men! For the czar!
For the... what?
*BOOM*
... Never mind. For the czar!
*THUD*
*CRACK*
*WHAM*
I don't think I'll ever get used to watching it. The crew mauling a Morgana...
Aboard this ship, you must.

Fields.MenuText: It's the right thing to do.

Fields.DialogueText: You know who gives orders aboard this ship, Kapitan.
It is the true face of war.
I am glad we see eye to eye.
This whole time, you've been talking about the penalty for mutiny being death...
You wouldn't give that order, either. The Fleet needs me.
But?
You'd order them to even if I told you not to?
*You* need me.
Because of your visions?
@BATTLE
They're retreating. Grab that Morgana off the deck-- we'll make an example of her!
Because of my *vision.*
You do not need me to bring about a future I've seen.
You need me because I will *create* the future. A future where humanity survives.
I need you for other reasons.
A weakness you should correct, Kapitan. But that reminds me.
Did you see the way the Morganas moved, in the last battle?
... It was like one of the visions. There weren't as many of them, but...
They're trying to get into your head, Comrade Kapitan. Don't let them.
You *are* giving orders now.
*THUD*
*WHACK*
If it hurts your pride, I will save them for when they're needed.
*THUD*
I'll see you on the bridge.
Roger.
... Yes, but I still outrank you.
In theory. In practice? A different story.
There. Safe.
You sacrificed your rook.
But I'm out of check. The game goes on.
For how much longer?
Until one of us runs out of pieces. Or you corner me.
I'm surprised how easily you accept defeat.
Only at *your* hands.
Ah, so you *want* me to overpower you?
Something like that.
"Oh, vot is zis, mine enemy is not vorthy of my steel!"
Is *that* how I sound to you?
I may have exaggerated a bit.
Mm-*hm.*
There was something I wanted to ask you...
Ah?
I don't claim to know everything, but--
*ALARM*
Taking a sudden interest? Do you want to psychoanalyze me, comrade?
Have we not beaten this horse enough, Kapitan?
Rats. There goes our game.
And the scintillating conversation, too. Pity.
We'll have to continue another time. By the way...
Check.
You should be ashamed of yourself. Exposing such weakness?
So you won't go down without a fight?
@BATTLE
What are you going to do about it? Be disappointed?
Of course not. Otherwise, it'd be no fun.
Zzz...
Aurora? Are you asleep again?
Zzz-- Kapitan!
Are you all right? You're white as a ghost.
Yes. Give me a second to compose myself.
Affirmative.
Ugh.
Bad vision?
Things did not go according to plan.
Do they ever?
Hah. Haaaaah. You need better plans.

Fields.MenuText: These visions really take it out of you.
You need some water or something?
I'd say you need a nap, but...

Fields.DialogueText: You're kind, but no. I just need a moment.
You underestimate me. I will be fine.
Don't make me laugh!
It's happening more often, isn't it?
... It has always happened, Kapitan. As far back as I can remember.
Even when I was asleep, I lay dreaming of terrible fates.
Wait, you mean... *asleep* asleep? Before you were a Belle?
Mm. You know, it's funny...
I'll begin to tell a story of my days with Rozhestvensky's fleet, or of the October Revolution...
And I'll hesitate, because in my visions... there were Morganas there.
But not in reality.
No. But it becomes difficult to remember which is which, after a while.
... Just tell me if you *can't* remember anymore.
Of course.
*ALARM*
All right, people, we've got company! Look alive!
We advance, or we die.
@BATTLE
I am *not* in Kansas anymore. This is a wooden ship.
And I don't know what language they're speaking, but I can understand it anyway...
Captain, we've got sea-devils coming in from all sides!
... Why am I not surprised? Where's Aurora?
Preparing to board the enemy vessel. Get ready.

Fields.MenuText: I'm as ready as I'll ever be.
If I can move this time, I will.

Fields.DialogueText: For the love of... Those are modern ships. We're on a galley and they have triple-gun turrets.
What? I don't understand...
You will. Or you will regret it.
Says the Kapitan who believes one can share visions with a cruiser.
Good. Steel yourself and gather your forces.
On my count. Three.... two... one...
Let's begin.
@BATTLE
When will it end?
Captain, they've blown a hole in the hull! We're going to sink--
So we take the Morgana ship.
@BATTLE
Kapitan! Give me your hand, and I'll pull you across!
I'm slipping--
I won't let go.
Aurora--
*BOOM*
Aaaah!
(The ship's gone down and I've gone down with it.)
(If you die in a vision.... is that the end?)
*GASP!*
Kapitan. Pull yourself together!
... You pulled me back aboard.
I did.
Now is not the time to lose heart. We have survived every battle we have fought thus far.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't lose heart; my hand slipped.
... Sometimes all you can do is make it to tomorrow.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. We may not see eye to eye, but you are still my Kapitan. And... much, much more.
This is true. But tomorrow will always come. No matter how long the night, the day will break.
The visions are like dreams, Kapitan. If you wanted, you could bend reality to your will.
I didn't take you for an optimist.
For better or worse, I love you too.
Go freshen up. You look like death froze over.
Make yourself some of that coffee.
Very funny.
You can make the hint, but you can't take it?
Fair enough. I'll make the coffee.
If you like, I'll share it with you.
I'd like that a lot.
I'll *never* let go.
Hm. You've made a mistake, Kapitan.
Ah?
You left your queen wide open. That's check, by the way.
Damn. You're good at this.
All it takes is a little forethought.
Apropos of that, I've been meaning to ask...
Hm?
About Kanzaki. The saboteur.
He had already attempted to kill me. He'd gladly do so again.
Given the circumstances... what I did could be construed as self-defense. Don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: It was premeditated. That makes a difference.
I mean, you're not wrong, but...
If you're innocent, then you have nothing to fear from an investigation.

Fields.DialogueText: Have I ever been?
And Kanzaki's actions weren't?
Frankly, I would not have much to fear if I was guilty.
I believe that's checkmate.
... No, I can still move my king *here.*
You can't run forever.
*ALARM*
It looks like the Morganas have saved the day.
There's a first time for everything, I suppose.
@BATTLE
... Well, this is it. I drafted a letter to Command.
I wrote that I'd fully support an investigation into what happened aboard.
But is that really the right thing to do?
*RRRRIP*
There's the stamp. It's in Command's hands now.
Command might still send an investigator, but it won't be on my recommendation.
*ALARM*
Comrade Kapitan! We need you on the bridge.
I'll be there in a second.
(... Did I do the right thing?)
@BATTLE
Praefectus, wake up! There are strange ships on the horizon!
... Mgnkl... another damn vision?
They're surrounding us! What do we do?
They have guns - I mean, Greek fire - and we're on a wooden boat. We've got to run.
We do not have to run.
Ah! You snuck up on us.
Remember what I told you, comrade? These visions aren't quite real. Within them, we can make our own fate.
I... see.
I will do what I can to protect the ship. But you need to get us alongside the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: If this is a vision, can't you teleport us?

Fields.DialogueText: We have no weapons to speak of.
Unfortunately, I am well aware of my capabilities.
Good. Let's finish this.
We have sailors. And you have me.
Since you know you can't do it, you can't do it.
Exactly. And while I've been working on improving my capabilities...
*BOOM*
Get down!
@BATTLE
What's Greek fire?
Oh, for the love of--
The strength of humanity, and the strength of a warship, fighting side by side.
We've lost two ships, Praefectus!
I know. But we have Aurora. She'll protect us.
I can't believe it. To see a goddess, with one's own eyes...

Fields.MenuText: She'll save us all. Keep rowing.
She's the ship's kami-- I mean, spirit.

Fields.DialogueText: Hah. Their superstition may yet save us.
We're getting close. Prepare to board.
What else *could* she be? Aurora is the goddess of dawn.
Aurora is the goddess of the dawn. If she's the ship's spirit, why does she look like her?
And we have your fleet, Kapitan. Good work.
It's strange that they're always there, no matter where these visions take us...
You trust that your comrades will be there when you need them. So they are.
Finally... we advance.
@BATTLE
You won't argue?
You're the goddess of my heart.
How disgustingly sweet of you.
-- And if these sailors think they have a goddess on their side, they'll fight harder.
We've made it! We boarded the Morgana ship.
No time to rest on your laurels. Let's grab that witch.
@BATTLE
The Morgana cleared the deck. It's just her and me.
Ssssssss... You know nothing... and understand still less......

Fields.MenuText: Stand down. I don't want to hurt you.
You want some of this? Come get it!
This is for Macnair - and all our dead!

Fields.DialogueText: No mercy, Kapitan.  We're well past that point.
Give her your all!
Vengeance is yours, comrade.
*THUD*
*SLAM*
Is she... dead? I don't think she's breathing...
*THUD*
*CRUNCH*
Its screams are music to my ears.
I didn't expect them to crucify her.
No, but it's effective, isn't it?
When you put it that way...
It's almost a shame that none of this is real.
These sailors think I am a goddess, and they have none of your modern scruples. Imagine what we could do with ten crews like this...
You'd paint the whole world red.
Mmm. I'll take that as a compliment.
Does it matter? The enemy is out of commission.
Give her to the crew. They'll know what to do with her.
Here goes nothing.
The vision's over. The Morgana's dead, but... no Romans or crosses anywhere...
.... Mmn. Kapitan.
Do you feel well-rested?
As well as one could expect.
I'll make that coffee.
Thank you.
*sip* This is the good stuff.
Indeed.
I meant to ask... About your visions.
Why do you think I'm sharing them?
Well, I have no proof of this,  but... I think it's simple, Kapitan.
You would follow me to the ends of the earth. And I needed you to follow me.

Fields.MenuText: So you brought me like I brought our fleet?
I'd do the same for any of my Belles.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. Your loyalty is admirable. And useful.
Of course. That's the sort of person you are. Effortlessly loyal.
Precisely. I needed you to do what you do best. And you did.
Thank you.
So, what happens now?
*ALARM*
Apparently, a battle. Shall we?
Just don't make me crucify anyone this time.
Wouldn't dream of it.
@BATTLE
Aurora? I have a strange question for you.
I may have a strange answer.
Would you do... what you did in your visions in reality?
Did I do something that I normally wouldn't?
No, and that's what worries me.
If you are worried that I would crucify another Morgana, put yourself at ease.
I am *fully* aware that that would be a political nightmare for the Fleet.
Besides, it wouldn't work.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean by that?
Morganas can come back from the dead.
The Christians would pitch a fit.

Fields.DialogueText: Da. That's exactly why it wouldn't work.
It's very simple, Kapitan.
Yes, but that's not why we bring them aboard.
A sailor might go to war to fight for her homeland, or her god, or her revolution.
But in the thick of a battle? With enemies on all sides? Fear makes her forgetful.
True. When things get ugly, all you can think about is your people.
That's exactly it.
If you have killed a Morgana with your own hands, you know they can be beaten. That takes some teeth away from the fear.
You could do that just by shooting her.
You could. But there is another piece to the puzzle.
Go on...
If you know that your comrades in arms can destroy a Morgana, with their bare hands, and that they expect the same of you...
You will be more likely to stand and fight. Both because you trust that they can destroy a Morgana... and because you know they expect you to do the same.
Shame is a powerful motivator.
The Morgana beatings... they are to build trust between the members of the crew. An unbreakable bond.
By building this trust, we strengthen them as a unit. We build cohesion.
And crucifying a Morgana would do the exact opposite?
Da. The Christians would squawk like the chickens they are.
If, when you look at your crewmates, you see blasphemers and traitors, you do not have that unbreakable bond.
So it would be very counterproductive.
You really are as cold as ice.
Thank you.
*ALARM*
To business, then.
I think my "coldness" is affecting you, comrade.
Don't push your luck.
@BATTLE
There's no Morganas to save you from me this time, Kapitan.
No. You've really got me pinned down.
What can I say? I enjoy strategy.
And I can get into your head quite easily, Kapitan.
Lately you've been living there rent-free.
Of course I have. Your investigation effort is commendable, if misplaced.
Who said I meant the investigation?

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to pursue the investigation, whatever it takes.

Fields.DialogueText: Why continue? You know this is futile.
Why give up now?

Fields.MenuText: Because this was a waste of time and resources.
Because no one puts my crew in danger. Not even you.

Fields.DialogueText: As ever, you're loyal to a fault.
A lofty ideal, but one so rarely put into practice. Especially against those you love.
Between your strategic mind and your visions... you're a valuable asset and a reliable ally.
The whole fleet needs you, whether we like it or not.
If the worst you'll get is a slap on the wrist no matter what, sending someone out to slap you is a waste of everyone's time.
Someone's got to try.
You've got my loyalty, too. You're part of my crew. But you crossed a line.
It's true. Formalities in wartime are a waste.
I admire your zeal, Kapitan. It is a shame that there are so many ways in which we disagree.
...I can't imagine it either.
But I must say, I'm disappointed. I thought your convictions were stronger than that.
*ALARM*
No matter where our principles stand, we can agree that Morganas need to be destroyed.
Absolutely. I'll take the radio, if you don't mind.
Be my guest.
@BATTLE
Oh, I'm sure it's just one of many reasons.
But since you're so willing to open your heart to your enemy... how *is* the investigation going?
...and besides all that... I need you. I can't imagine what life would be without you at my side.
And I'm pleased to hear that you've seen reason.
Aurora? Are you asleep?
No. Just lost in thought.
@BATTLE
About what?
About the visions.
You want to talk, I'm here.
... I cannot shake the feeling, Kapitan, that we are trapped in a cycle.
Everything I've seen in my visions... it has happened before, one way or another. And it will all happen again.

Fields.MenuText: So you need to reach enlightenment?
So we keep fighting until the end of time.

Fields.DialogueText: If we have to, yes. But I don't think we have to.
Of course not.
How very cultured of you, Kapitan.
I cannot help but think that there's something we're missing. A piece of a greater puzzle.
Well, knowing you, you'll find it. No matter what you have to do.
I'd sacrifice anything to end the Morgana crisis.
But I can't help but think that... we don't need to sacrifice anything. There is so much we don't know.
Well, you keep having these visions, and maybe you'll figure it out.
There is no "maybe." I *will* see it through to the end. And you will be beside me.
Do I have a choice?
Of course. But I know you all too well.
You followed me in the realm of visions. You will follow me in the waking world.
And whether you are at my side, or across enemy lines ... we *will* irrevocably change it.
Even me?
If I had no other choice? Yes.
Give them no quarter! They die here and now!
